googleSheetVaApiDataRow.earlyVotingNotes:
Alaska is a no excuse absentee voting state. Anyone may vote using the early and in-person absentee voting options.

At the time you vote, your eligibility to vote in that election is verified by the absentee voting official. The official will look up your name in the voter registration database and will verify that your registration is active and current. If your registration is active and current, the official will print off a voter certificate with your information that you will sign. You will then be given a ballot to vote that is dropped into a ballot box after voting.

Early voting is only available at certain absentee voting locations that the division can establish a secure connection with the voter registration database system. Early voting is available in Juneau, Soldotna, Anchorage, Wasilla, Fairbanks and Nome at designated locations.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmNotes: Alaska is a no-excuse absentee voting state. Absentee ballots are counted beginning election night and up to 15 days after Election Day.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Alaska driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Enter your Alaska driver’s license or Alaska State Identification card number. If you don't have one, enter the last 4 digits of your social security number. If you don't have any of these numbers, write “NONE” in the box.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Alaska voter can request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.sdrNotes: According to the EAC, Alaska does offer Election Day Registration for presidential elections.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfSubmissionAddress:
Division of Elections  
State of Alaska  
PO Box 110017  
Juneau, AK 99811‐0017
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: All Alaska voters must show a non-expired ID issued by the State of Alaska or the Federal Government. Acceptable forms of ID include a driver's license, state ID card, a military ID, a US passport, a hunting or fishing license.  If you don't have a photo ID, bring a utility bill, paycheck, government check, or bank statement that shows your full name and Alaska address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: The Local Election Office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license.  If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected.  Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges: Alaska voters can request a mail-in ballot online.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: Alaska has a closed primary system. If you do not register for a political party, you will not be able to vote in that party's primary.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have an Alaska driver's license or state ID card that shows your current address. If not, you can still register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Alaska voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
